tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE CustomerServiceTickets ( 
  ticket_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  customer_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
  issue_description TEXT, 
  resolution_status VARCHAR(20), 
  create_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL 
)

CREATE TABLE customer_tickets (
    ticket_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    issue_description TEXT,
    resolution_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'Pending',
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE TABLE ticket_history (
    history_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    ticket_id INT NOT NULL,
    action_taken TEXT,
    action_timestamp TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
    FOREIGN KEY (ticket_id) REFERENCES customer_tickets(ticket_id)
);

CREATE TABLE CustomerServiceTickets (
  ticket_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  issue_description TEXT,
  resolution_status VARCHAR(20),
  resolution_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE TicketHistory (
  history_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  ticket_id INT NOT NULL,
  agent_id INT NOT NULL,
  action_taken TEXT,
  action_date DATETIME,
  FOREIGN KEY (ticket_id) REFERENCES CustomerServiceTickets(ticket_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (agent_id) REFERENCES CustomerServiceAgents(agent_id)
);

CREATE TABLE tickets (
  ticket_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  issue_description TEXT,
  status VARCHAR(50),
  resolved BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE ticket_history (
  history_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  ticket_id INT,
  agent_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  notes TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE CustomerIssues (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  issue_description TEXT,
  status VARCHAR(50),
  resolution_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE Customers (
  customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_name VARCHAR(100),
  email VARCHAR(100),
  phone_number VARCHAR(15),
  address TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE CustomerTickets (
  ticket_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  issue_description TEXT,
  assigned_to VARCHAR(100),
  priority VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE TicketComments (
  comment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  ticket_id INT,
  commenter_name VARCHAR(100),
  comment_text TEXT,
  comment_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE TicketHistory (
  history_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  ticket_id INT,
  status VARCHAR(50),
  assigned_to VARCHAR(100),
  last_update DATE
)
